types.name: ChargetripRange
types.description:
Chargetrip's custom real-world range provides a carefully calculated display range for all-electric vehicle models.
Chargetrip range is based on the theoretical distance driven using only the electric engine.
Vehicles that do not have a full electric drivetrain type (all except Battery Electric Vehicles / BEV) therefore return relatively small ranges.
More information on the CT range can be found at https://chargetrip.com/blog/what-is-ct-real-range

fields.name: worst
fields.description:
Range calculated using the worst conditions.
Worst conditions are based on -0째C, including use of heating.
More information on the CT range can be found at https://chargetrip.com/blog/what-is-ct-real-range

fields.name: best
fields.description:
Range calculated using the best conditions.
Best conditions are based on 25째C, including use of A/C.
More information on the CT range can be found at https://chargetrip.com/blog/what-is-ct-real-range

types.name: Connector
types.description: Connector data which extends OCPI Connector.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier of a connector within an EVSE. Two connectors may have the same ID as long as they do not belong to the same EVSE object. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: standard
fields.description: Standard of an installed connector. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: format
fields.description: Format (socket/cable) of an installed connector. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: power_type
fields.description: Type of power of an installed connector. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_voltage
fields.description: Maximum voltage of an connector (line to neutral for AC_3_PHASE), in volt [V]. For example: DC Chargers might vary the voltage during charging when battery almost full. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_amperage
fields.description: Maximum amperage of a connector, in ampere [A]. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_electric_power
fields.description:
Maximum electric power that can be delivered by a connector, in watt [W]. When the maximum electric power is lower than the calculated value from voltage and amperage, this value should be set.
For example: A DC Charge Point which can deliver up to 920V and up to 400A can be limited to a maximum of 150kW. Depending on the vehicle, it may supply maximum voltage or current, but not both at the same time.
For AC Charge Points, the amount of phases used can also have influence on the maximum power. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: power
fields.description: Maximum electric power in kW.

fields.name: tariff_ids
fields.description:
Identifiers of the currently valid charging tariffs. Multiple tariffs are possible, but only one of each Tariff.type can be active at the same time. Tariffs with the same type are only allowed, if they are not active at the same time: start_date_time and end_date_time period not overlapping.
When preference-based smart charging is supported, one tariff for every possible ProfileType should be provided. This tells the user about the options they have at this Connector, and what the tariff is for every option.
For a "free of charge" tariff, this field should be set and point to a defined "free of charge" tariff. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: terms_and_conditions
fields.description: URL to an operators terms and conditions. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when a connector was last updated (or created). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application. This extends the current functionalities we offer.

fields.name: tariff
fields.description: List of valid charging tariffs.

fields.description: Charging prices.

fields.description: Applicable price excluding VAT.

fields.name: vat
fields.description: Applicable VAT.

fields.name: step_size
fields.description:
Indicates the minimum amount that is billed. A
unit is billed in step-size blocks. For example, if the type is TIME and step_size is 300, then the time is billed in blocks of 5 minutes. Hence, if 6 minutes is used, then 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) is billed.

	Note: step_size also depends on the type. Every type (except FLAT) defines a step_size multiplier. This is the size of every 'step' and the unit. For example, PARKING_TIME has a step-size multiplier of 1 second. Therefore, the step_size of a price component is multiplied by 1 second. Thus, step_size = 300 means 300 seconds.

fields.name: reservation
fields.description:
When this field is present, the ConnectorPriceElement describes reservation costs.
A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the driver starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location,
or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: `flat` and `time` ConnectorPriceElementComponentType,
where time is for the duration of the reservation.

When a price has both, `reservation` and `reservation_expires` ConnectorPriceElement,
where both ConnectorPriceElement have a time ConnectorPriceElementComponent,
then the time based cost of an expired reservation will be calculated based on the `reservation_expires` ConnectorPriceElement.

types.name: EVSE
types.description: EVSE data which extends OCPI EVSE.

fields.name: uid
fields.description:
Uniquely identifies an EVSE within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). For example a database ID or the actual "EVSE ID". This field can never be changed, modified or renamed. This is the 'technical' identification of the EVSE, not to be used as 'human readable' identification, use the field evse_id for that.
This field is named uid instead of id, because id could be confused with evse_id which is an eMI3 defined field. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: evse_id
fields.description: Compliant with the following specification for EVSE ID from "eMI3 standard version V1.0" (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) "Part 2: business objects." Optional because: if an evse_id is to be re-used in the real world, the evse_id can be removed from an EVSE object if the status is set to REMOVED. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Indicates the current status of an EVSE. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: status_schedule
fields.description: Indicates a planned status update of a nEVSE. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: capabilities
fields.description: List of functionalities that an EVSE is capable of. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: connectors
fields.description: List of available connectors on an EVSE. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: floor_level
fields.description: Level on which a Charge Point is located (in garage buildings) in the locally displayed numbering scheme. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: Coordinates of a EVSE. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: physical_reference
fields.description: A number/string printed on the outside of an EVSE for visual identification. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: parking_restrictions
fields.description: Restrictions that apply to a parking spot. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: images
fields.description: Links to images related to an EVSE such as photos or logos. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when this EVSE or one of its Connectors was last updated (or created). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: parking_cost
fields.description: Indicates if parking is free or paid.

Remove a review added by an authenticated user.
The `x-token` header is mandatory in order to authorize the user who wants to remove a review.
In case it is not sent, an error will occur.
In case the review was not found or belongs to another user an error will occur.
This is a premium feature, contact Chargetrip for more information.

fields.name: excl_vat
fields.description: Price/Cost excluding VAT. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: incl_vat
fields.description: Price/Cost including VAT. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of tariff dimension. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price per unit (excl. VAT) for this tariff dimension. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: vat
fields.description: Applicable VAT percentage for this tariff dimension. If omitted, no VAT is applicable. Not providing a VAT is different from 0% VAT, which would be a value of 0.0 here. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: step_size
fields.description: Minimum amount to be billed. This unit will be billed in this step_size blocks. For example: if type is TIME and step_size has a value of 300, then time will be billed in blocks of 5 minutes. If 6 minutes were used, 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) will be billed. This property is OCPI-compliant.

types.name: OCPIRegularHours
types.description: Regular recurring operation or access hours.

fields.name: weekday
fields.description: Number of days in the week, from Monday (1) till Sunday (7). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: period_begin
fields.description: Begin of the regular period, in local time, given in hours and minutes. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Example: "18:15". Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[1-3]):[0-5][0-9]. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: period_end
fields.description: End of the regular period, in local time, syntax as for period_begin. Must be later than period_begin. This property is OCPI-compliant.

enumValues.name: RESERVATION
enumValues.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation.

enumValues.name: RESERVATION_EXPIRES
enumValues.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation that expires (i.e. driver does not start a charging session before expiry_date of the reservation).

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is able to start a new charging session.

enumValues.name: BLOCKED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is not accessible because of a physical barrier, i.e. a car.

enumValues.name: CHARGING
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is in use.

enumValues.name: INOPERATIVE
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is not yet active or it is no longer available (deleted).

enumValues.name: OUTOFORDER
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is currently out of order.

enumValues.name: PLANNED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is planned, will be operating soon.

enumValues.name: REMOVED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector was discontinued/removed.

enumValues.name: RESERVED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is reserved for a particular EV driver and is unavailable for other drivers.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: No status information available (also used when offline).

types.name: OCPIStatusSchedule
types.description: This type is used to schedule status periods in the future. The eMSP can provide this information to the EV user for trip planning purposes. A period MAY have no end. Example: "This station will be running as of tomorrow. Today it is still planned and under construction.

fields.name: period_begin
fields.description: Begin of the scheduled period. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: period_end
fields.description: End of the scheduled period, if known. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status value during the scheduled period. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this tariff. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Uniquely identifies the tariff within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given charging preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: tariff_alt_text
fields.description: List of alternative tariff information texts, in multiple languages. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: tariff_alt_url
fields.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: min_price
fields.description: When this field is set, a charging session with this tariff will cost at least the amount shown. This is different from a FLAT fee (start tariff, transaction fee), as a FLAT fee is a fixed amount that must be paid for any charging session. A minimum price indicates that when the cost of a charging session is lower than this amount, the cost of the session will be equal to this amount. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_price
fields.description: When this field is set, a charging session with this tariff will NOT cost more than this amount. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: elements
fields.description: List of tariff elements. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: start_date_time
fields.description: Time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: end_date_time
fields.description: Time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: energy_mix
fields.description: Details about the energy supplied with this tariff. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when this tariff was last updated (or created). This property is OCPI-compliant.

enumValues.name: ENERGY
enumValues.description: Defined in kWh, step_size multiplier: 1 Wh

enumValues.name: FLAT
enumValues.description: Flat fee without unit for step_size

enumValues.name: PARKING_TIME
enumValues.description: Time not charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second

enumValues.name: TIME
enumValues.description: Time charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second Can also be used in combination with a RESERVATION restriction to describe the price of the reservation time.

fields.name: price_components
fields.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: restrictions
fields.description: Restrictions that describe the applicability of a tariff. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: Start time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 13:30, valid from this time of the day. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[1-3]):[0-5][0-9]. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: end_time
fields.description: End time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 19:45, valid until this time of the day. Same syntax as start_time. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: Start date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-24, valid from this day. Regex: ([12][0-9]{3})-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: End date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-27, valid until this day (exclusive). Same syntax as start_date. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: min_kwh
fields.description: Minimum consumed energy in kWh, for example 20, valid from this amount of energy being used. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_kwh
fields.description: Maximum consumed energy in kWh, for example 50, valid until this amount of energy being used. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: min_current
fields.description: Sum of the minimum current in over all phases, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of current, this tariff element is/becomes active. If the charging current is or becomes lower, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This does not describe the minimum current over the entire charging session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging current is above the defined value, but the tariff element MUST no longer be active when the charging current drops below the defined value. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_current
fields.description: Sum of the maximum current in over all phases, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of current, this tariff element becomes/is active. If the charging current is or becomes higher, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging current is below this value, but the tariff element MUST  no longer be active when the charging current raises above the defined value. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: min_power
fields.description: Minimum power in kW, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of power, this tariff element is/becomes active. If the charging power is or becomes lower, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This does not describe the minimum power over the entire charging session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging power is above this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power drops below the defined value. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_power
fields.description: Maximum power in kW, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of power, this tariff element becomes/is active. If the charging power is or becomes higher, this tariff element is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This does not describe the maximum power over the entire charging session. This restriction can make a tariff element become active when the charging power is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power raises above the defined value. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: min_duration
fields.description: Minimum duration in seconds the charging session MUST last (inclusive). When the duration of a charging session is longer than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. Before that moment, this tariff element is not yet active. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: max_duration
fields.description: Maximum duration in seconds the charging session MUST last (exclusive). When the duration of a charging session is shorter than the defined value, this tariff element is or becomes active. After that moment, this tariff element is no longer active. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: day_of_week

fields.name: reservation
fields.description: When this field is present, the tariff element describes reservation costs. A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the drivers starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location, or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: FLAT and TIME TariffDimensions, where TIME is for the duration of the reservation. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.description: [BETA] Defines a driving style. If provided in combination with 'maximum_speed' or 'speed_factor', those values override the values defined by the selected 'style'.

enumValues.description: Lower average driving speed and lower energy consumption. Applies a speed limit of 110 km/h to all segments where a higher legal limit is allowed and reduces by 5% the route's average driving speed.

enumValues.description: Higher average driving speed and higher energy consumption. Applies no speed limit and increases by 5% the route's average driving speed.

types.name: Station
types.description: Station data which extends OCPI Location.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of a station. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of a station. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: CPO ID of a CPO that 'owns' this station (following the ISO-15118 standard). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: publish
fields.description:
Defines if a location may be published on a website or app etc.
When this is set to false, only tokens identified in the field: publish_allowed_to are allowed to show this location.
When the same location has EVSEs that may be published and may not be published, two 'locations' should be created. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of a charging station. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Street/block name and house number if available. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City or town. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: postal_code
fields.description: Postal code of a location, may only be omitted when a location has no postal code: in some countries charging locations at highways dont have postal codes. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State or province of a location, only to be used when relevant. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: country
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code for the country of this station. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: Coordinates of a location. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: related_locations
fields.description: Geographical location of related points relevant to a user. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: parking_type
fields.description: Type of parking at a charge point location. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: evses
fields.description: EVSEs that belong to a station. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: directions
fields.description: Human-readable directions on how to reach a station. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: operator
fields.description: Information about an operator. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: suboperator
fields.description: Information about a suboperator if applicable. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: Information about an owner if available. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: facilities
fields.description: Facilities a charging station belongs to. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: time_zone
fields.description: Value from the IANA time zone database representing the time zone of a location. Examples: "Europe/Oslo", "Europe/Zurich". (http://www.iana.org/time-zones). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: opening_times
fields.description: Times when an EVSEs at a location can be accessed for charging. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: charging_when_closed
fields.description: Indicates if the EVSEs are still charging outside the opening hours. E.g. when a parking garage closes its barriers overnight, is it allowed to charge till the next morning? Default: true. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: images
fields.description: Links to images related to a location such as photos or logos. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: energy_mix
fields.description: Details of the energy supplied at a location. This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when a location, or one of its EVSEs or Connectors were last updated (or created). This property is OCPI-compliant.

fields.name: external_id
fields.description: ID provided by a station data source.

fields.name: location
fields.description: GeoJSON location of a charging station.

fields.name: elevation
fields.description: Elevation (altitude) level.

fields.name: chargers
fields.description: Groups of EVSEs by power and type.

fields.name: amenities
fields.description: Amenities located at this location.

fields.name: physical_address
fields.description: Enriched information about the physical address of a station.

fields.name: heavy_vehicles_properties
fields.description: Describes the heavy vehicle properties at the location.

fields.name: heavy_vehicles_restrictions
fields.description: Describes the heavy vehicle restrictions at the location.

fields.name: vehicle_restrictions
fields.description: Describes the vehicle restrictions at the location.

fields.name: location_category
fields.description: Type of location where the charge point is located. For example, shop.

fields.name: entrance_for_navigation
fields.description: Coordinates for the location's entrances in decimal degrees. If available, there can be more than one entrances to the location.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application. This extends the current functionalities we offer.

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: A flag that indicates if a station has real-time information about the availability of its connectors.

fields.name: private
fields.description: A flag that indicates if a station is on private property.

fields.name: power
fields.description: Connectors grouped by power.

fields.name: predicted_availability
fields.description: Station availability.
fields.deprecationReason: predicted_availability, no value will be sent. Deprecated in favor of predicted_occupancy.

fields.name: predicted_occupancy
fields.description: Predicted station occupancy.

fields.name: speed

fields.name: status
fields.description: Global status for a station.

fields.name: custom_properties
fields.description: Custom properties of a station. These are vendor specific and will return null values on the fields that are not supported by your station database.

fields.name: review
fields.description: Review of a station.

fields.name: roaming

fields.name: support_phone_number
fields.description: Phone number for assistance at a charging station.

fields.name: charging_behaviour

fields.name: reliability_score

fields.description: Occupancy on a scale from 1 to 10, where 1 means free for charging and 10 means fully occupied.

fields.name: partner_id
fields.description: Unique id for a provider. It is created by Eco-Movement, and it is stable.

fields.name: ema_id
fields.description:
Unique E-Mobility Account Identifier (eMA ID) for a provider.
It is created by Eco-Movement by combining the country code where the charging station is located, and the party id of the provider.
For example, NL-ECO. Note: A provider can have multiple eMA IDs.
For example, if a company named 'Example Company A' acquired 'Example Company B' and owns the charging stations of Example Company B,
then this attribute maps Example Company B's eMA IDs to Example Company A's eMA IDs. For example, ['NL-EXA', 'NL-EXB'].

fields.name: chargetrip_range
fields.description:
Chargetrip's custom real-world range provides a carefully calculated display range for all-electric vehicle models.
Chargetrip range is based on the theoretical distance driven using only the electric engine.
Vehicles that do not have a full electric drivetrain type (all except Battery Electric Vehicles / BEV) therefore return relatively small ranges.
More information on the CT range can be found at https://chargetrip.com/blog/what-is-ct-real-range

fields.name: chargetrip_range
fields.description:
Chargetrip's custom real-world range provides a carefully calculated display range for all-electric vehicle models.
Chargetrip range is based on the theoretical distance driven using only the electric engine.
Vehicles that do not have a full electric drivetrain type (all except Battery Electric Vehicles / BEV) therefore return relatively small ranges.
More information on the CT range can be found at https://chargetrip.com/blog/what-is-ct-real-range

enumValues.name: motorcycle
enumValues.description: Any motor vehicle with two wheels or a motor vehicle with no more than four wheels, does not have parallel seating, and is controlled by means of handlebars.

enumValues.name: microcar
enumValues.description: A motor vehicle with three or four wheels that is not a Motorcycle, Pickup, Van, Truck, or Utility vehicle and either has a top speed of less than 60kph or an unladen weight of less than 400kg.

enumValues.name: car
enumValues.description: A motor vehicle that does not have an enclosed cab, is not a microcar or utility vehicle, is capable of carrying eight or fewer people, and that has less than one third of its internal volume dedicated to cargo, living, or sleeping space in its default configuration.

enumValues.name: pickup
enumValues.description: A motor vehicle that has an enclosed cab, is not a utility vehicle, and has a fixed, non-articulated, open-top back cargo bed that is enclosed on at least three sides.

enumValues.name: van
enumValues.description:
A motor vehicle that does not have an enclosed cab, is not a utility vehicle, that fulfills exactly one of the following conditions:
1) It is capable of carrying more than eight but less than twenty people.
2) At least one third of its internal volume is dedicated to cargo space in its default configuration.
3) It is the passenger variant of a vehicle that meets criterion 2.

enumValues.name: bus
enumValues.description: A motor vehicle that does not have an enclosed cab, is not a Utility vehicle, and is capable of carrying 20 or more people in its default configuration.

enumValues.name: truck
enumValues.description: A motor vehicle that has an enclosed cab and is not a Pickup or Utility vehicle.

enumValues.name: utility
enumValues.description:
A motor vehicle that fulfills at least one of the following conditions:
1) It does not have wheels.
2) It has some mode of locomotion other than wheels in its default configuration such as treads, skis, or floats.
3) It is capable of air or water travel in its default configuration.
4) It was manufactured primarily for some purpose other than transporting cargo or passengers.
5) It does not conform to any of the criteria for the other vehicle categories.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
